activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#467
activity.text: @rithviknishad Here the motive of pre-populate is that if there are no discussions or no GitHub event data present in the data-repo, then we only need to fetch historical data. Additionally, another suggestion is that the organization setting up the Leaderboard can enter a date up to which they need the data. This can happen during the initial setup or when the user prefers to clear out old data and fetch new data.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#430
activity.text:
I have one suggestion,
Instead of implementing `register/login` functionality, let's consider adding a `toggle` on the homepage to switch between `private` and `public` repositories. When a visitor toggles to view private repositories, we'll then validate whether the visitor is allowed access.
It is less complicated i guess.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#373
activity.text: @rithviknishad Even if we utilize the `GraphQL API`, we still encounter the same issue. We'd need to initially retrieve all repositories and their associated forks before we can access their commits. While pagination can help mitigate rate limit problems, it may not be applicable in this scenario since we're scraping data.

activity.text: @rithviknishad Please review this and merge this.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#396
activity.text:
@rithviknishad, your requested changes have been implemented:

1. Changed `logo.webp` to `logo.jpg` and created a `symlink` for this.
2. Moved Roboto-Bold.ttf to the public directory since Google Font is not supported at the edge time.
3. Converted all possible CSS to Tailwind CSS in the OG route. However, please note that `Tailwind CSS` is experimental in og-images, so some styling remains in normal CSS.
4. Added metadataBase: new URL(env.NEXT_PUBLIC_META_URL) in the `layout.tsx` file to address the mentioned error.

![Screenshot 2024-03-23 102106](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/leaderboard/assets/99136186/f48811e9-6c59-405e-a482-4e29f3dfff55)

Let me know if there's anything else you need!

activity.text: logo.webp to logo.jpg

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#373
activity.text:
Yup, It's possible
Here are the steps

1. Fetch your main repository: First,  fetch information about the main repository.
2. Fetch the forks of the main repository
3. Iterate through forks: For each fork, you'll fetch the commits made by the contributors in their forked repositories.

![Screenshot 2024-03-22 191640](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/leaderboard/assets/99136186/34bde2ef-cb79-4e2c-864c-e1bbee217695)
![Screenshot 2024-03-22 191651](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/leaderboard/assets/99136186/b9b0c527-8537-4c8d-b571-cf71f8ffde90)


We can create these two functions or one by merging these two and call this from  scrapper function.

How it looks?
Regarding the logo, it appears black because when I use the`'logo. webp'` from the public directory, it's in white text. However, our OG image background is white, making it difficult to see. For the OG image, a white background is more suitable. Additionally, the leaderboard is a tool that will be used by other organizations, so each organization may prefer their logo. Therefore, I thought it best to use the same logo as found on the internet.

If there any suggestion regarding styling or addition?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#249
activity.text:
@rithviknishad for the updation script 

can I go for a change in load-fixtures.sh or create a new one?

: "${FIXTURES_SOURCE:=https://github.com/ohcnetwork/leaderboard-data.git}"

rm -rf data-repo
mkdir data-repo
cd data-repo

git init
git remote add --mirror=fetch origin ${FIXTURES_SOURCE}
git config core.sparseCheckout true

echo "data/" >> .git/info/sparse-checkout
echo "contributors/" >> .git/info/sparse-checkout
echo "tailwind.config.js" >> .git/info/sparse-checkout

git pull origin main

activity.title: ohcnetwork/leaderboard#249
activity.text:
### Themes suggestion:

**Techy Blue Theme:**
Primary Accent Color: #0366d6 (Blue)
Secondary Accent Color: #24292e (Dark Gray)
Neutral Color: #f6f8fa (Light Gray)
Text Color: #24292e (Dark Gray)

**Data-driven Green Theme:**
Primary Accent Color: #28a745 (Green)
Secondary Accent Color: #6cb2eb (Light Blue)
Neutral Color: #f8f9fa (Off-White)
Text Color: #333333 (Dark Gray)

**Code-friendly Dark Theme:**
Primary Accent Color: #6f42c1 (Purple)
Secondary Accent Color: #586069 (Gray)
Neutral Color: #1e1e1e (Dark Gray)
Text Color: #e1e4e8 (Light Gray)

**Corporate Navy Theme:**
Primary Accent Color: #0366d6 (Navy Blue)
Secondary Accent Color: #586069 (Gray)
Neutral Color: #f6f8fa (Light Gray)
Text Color: #24292e (Dark Gray)

**Minimalistic Monochrome Theme:**
Primary Accent Color: #333333 (Dark Gray)
Secondary Accent Color: #666666 (Medium Gray)
Neutral Color: #f8f9fa (Off-White)
Text Color: #24292e (Dark Gray)

@rithviknishad Hey, I think it is the best theme .5 themes are good number ?
